page.title: 14Lympne Castle
page.content: Lympne Castle stands on high ground near the site of the Roman Port, Portus Lemanis; and ten centuries later it was stone from the Roman fort that Lanfranc used to build both Lympne Castle and the Church. Most of the Castle dates from the thirteenth century, but the building has been adapted and altered by successive owners over the centuries. In the nineteenth century Sir Robert Lorimer was commissioned to restore it, but there followed a period of neglect until the present owners, Mr and Mrs Harry Margary spent many years restoring and repairing the fabric of the Castle which is now their family home. The Castle is open to the public from May to September.
